intro: Ixora americana, commonly known as the American flame tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is characterized by its dense, bright red or orange-red inflorescences that bloom throughout the year. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves that are elliptical in shape. Its flowers are clustered in terminal panicles and are pollinated primarily by birds and insects. Ixora americana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant flowers and adaptability to various soil types.
